page.title: 04Mills on the lower Coquet.
page.content: Until the late 19th.century most farming communities had their own corn mills,usually provided by the Lord of the Manor.Between Guyzance and Warkworth,on the River Coquet,there were several water mills and a wind powered mill.There was also a fulling mill at Wark Mill. The water mills at Morwick and Guyzance were in use from the 13th. century until early this century. Today there is little left of this once thriving industry.The mill race can be seen at Morwick and parts of Guyzance Mill were recently used to help restore Heatherslaw Mill in North Northumberland. The other mills survive in name only eg.Wark Mill.
